clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Fluid Extract of Chamomilla Tincture for Oral Aphthae
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 Evaluation of Therapeutic Effect of Chamomilla Tincture Mouthwash on Oral Aphthae

brief_summary.textblock: Recurrent aphthous stomatitis is a difficult to treat and quite common chronic inflammatory disease of the oral mucosa. This study evaluates the fluid extract from Chamomilla recutita's safety and effectiveness in treatment of aphthous stomatitis .

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: protocol designed to evaluate the effect of fluid extract from Chamomilla recutita's on treatment of aphthous stomatitis
primary_outcome.description: This study evaluates the fluid extract from Chamomilla recutita's effectiveness on healing rate of aphthous stomatitis, and reducing ulcer size

secondary_outcome.measure: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of chamomile mouthwash of decreasing the pain and frequency of oral aphthous ulcer
secondary_outcome.description: In the present work the Analogical Visual Scale is used TO evaluate pain,and we also record the frequency of ulcers monthly

arm_group.description: Chamomile comprises bisaboloids, matricine and chamazulene, flavonoids, and cumarins having therapeutical anti-inflammatory, analgesic, musculotropic, and spasmolytic action
placebo mouthwash is produced with the same taste and smell for using in placebo/ control group.

intervention.description: The patient is directed to mouth wash chamomilla tincture lightly three times a day,ten drops for each time,until ulcers completely heal
The patient is directed to use placebo mouthwash three times a day, ten drops for each time,until the ulcers completely heal
